website_summaries.verdict: A smart egg inventory management system isn't the worst idea, but Quirky's Egg Minder's approach lacks the sophistication to make this a worthwhile purchase.
pros: The Egg Minder is a sleek-looking kitchen gadget that, while it doesn't offer a lot of functional utility, has a lot of potential
cons: The app is glitchy and often inaccurate
In addition, the expiration date is determined by the user, which leaves a lot of room for error

customer_reviews.title: Runnnn Forest Run !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this eggminder because my husband thought it would be awesome to know when his eggs were going bad, I told him not to get his hopes up as it stays in a fridge and runs on radio signals ! But I couldn't even prove that to him as it wouldn't connect no matter how hard I tried and I have great wifi and new equipment. And don't hold your breath trying to get a refund back it's a no, not going to happen this is most definitely a hands down suck product I would have given it 3 for at least an effort for trying but even though its only 10.00 it pissed me off lol
customer_reviews.author: NanaWells

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: This device is supposed to keep track of how many eggs you have, so you can pull out your phone and see while you're at the store. It doesn't do that correctly. I currently have 5 eggs in my fridge, and the device thinks I have zero. It is also supposed to light up a small LED next to the oldest egg when you have it open so that you can grab the oldest egg. It doesn't do that correctly since it thinks I have zero eggs. I'm giving it two stars because 20% of the time it does work, and there isn't a better option that I am aware of.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Barely works part of the time.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like basic physics still survives in the SMART age. Radio signals have trouble entering or leaving a metal box. This device did not beat physics. Even when it managed to work (I put a Comcast extender next to the fridge) things never quite worked. Now that Wink wants $5 per month subscription the SMART is gone for this egg holder.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. One More Time

customer_reviews.title: Battery powered devices aren't great in the fridge
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these as white elephant gifts and every person that unwrapped one had the same issue..batteries don't like cold. I kept my eggs in this long after the batteries stopped working and the novelty had worn off because I like how eggs look in it. but the constant cold temperature of a fridge is no environment for a battery powered device. I am a professional audio mixer that works regularly in snowy conditions and know how quickly fresh batteries will die in cold weather. How temperature testing and battery compartment insulation wasn't improved upon in production is beyond me. It could have been more than a gimmick product.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great Egg Holder- bonus software
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product, not to mention it is a very well built, stand alone egg holder. The fact that it keeps track of how many eggs you have, how old they are and which one to use next is just an added bonus. I have show the app to so many people who say "oh my god I have to have one of those." This is not a sponsored review, I bought it during a sale and it was worth every penny. I wanted to share my experience with you as potential buyers because I hope you will do the same for all your purchases on Amazon, not just the negative reviews, but all reviews.
customer_reviews.author: DLP

customer_reviews.title: Have not used long enough to say I love it.
customer_reviews.text: Have not used long enough to say I love it...but I had issues connecting it to my WiFi network like so many. I think I may have found the (or a) reason for the inconsistency. I tried multiple times using my Nexus 6P and my wife's Moto X smartphones with no luck...so I tried my iPad mini, and it worked first time. Same settings as I tried numerous times on my Android phones with no luck. It it possible that the Android app is not functioning correctly with this for configuring via the "screen flashing" (guessing serial communication via light). So, if you have an Apple smartphone or tablet...you might want to give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: mgombar

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY IT.
customer_reviews.text: This was great until a month after I purchased it. It stopped working not sure why. I changed the battery and still only worked for a day... To change the batteries you need a screwdriver......really? Why they didn't make it a flip off cover to get at the batteries is beyond me. Great for storing eggs and that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this Egg Minder
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy one of these Egg Minders. It is not supported by the WINK Hub 2. I bought a WINK Hub and had to upgrade to the 2 for 5ghz wifi and the Egg Minders isn't supported. Mine is getting thrown in the trash can!
customer_reviews.author: Jake Tuckey

customer_reviews.title: I must have been really bored when I purchased this item
customer_reviews.text: I must have been really bored when I purchased this item, nothing worked as advertised and when you contact the seller they give you the it can be tricky to pair the item and can be tricky to do this & that, total B.S. Then I realized they don't except returns an I see why. This product is garbage, just go an by an egg tray at your local dollar store because that's all you will end up with, unless you're bored. I now understand the name of the product Quirky, the TRUTH lies in the name.
customer_reviews.author: C. H

customer_reviews.title: Useless.
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice but I can't use it. Comes with a note to go to a web site for a manual. No manual, just an announcement about a bankruptcy. So no software/app web site or any way to make the stupid thing work. Well at least it wasn't a $25000 car dependent on manufacturer support.
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to use.
customer_reviews.text: I received my Egg Minder, downloaded app and tried to syn with phone. Would not syn. Called customer service who told me it would not syn using 4G WIFI. Must have 2.4G - which I do not have. So impossible to use this product. Do not order the product. Good on Prime. They returned my money! Thanks Prime.
customer_reviews.author: barbreads

customer_reviews.title: DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY! HUGE rip off.
customer_reviews.text: DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY! It won’t pare. Wink’s help/cutomer support was very helpful. But, they told me that this model is old, discontinued. SO ~ you are only going to be getting an egg tray. And if you read the small print ~ you can’t return it. Mine is going into the trash. Total waste of money. HUGE rip off. I would give it ZERO stars if I could!
customer_reviews.author: Susie Bauer

customer_reviews.title: You Need This In Your Fridge!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife - initially as a gag gift - something that might give us a chuckle. However, this is actually a really cool product. I never really thought I knew I wanted to have an app on my phone that could tell me what eggs are new, old, etc...But now I do and life is grand. Seriously, this is a pretty fun product. Company was very interested to know how we were making out with our purchase too. Overall, a great experience. If only it could be paired to my Alexa...then I could talk and get updates about the eggs in my fridge WITHOUT ever opening up my fridge. :)
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work at all anymore - it's only 4 months old.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work. Which it did for about a month and a half. But ever since then, I've noticed the light doesn't come on when I open the fridge, like it used to, and when I pull it up on my phone, it's not syncing. I've replaced the batteries and have done a complete reset and it might work for a day or two but over the last month, I can't get it to work at all. Now it's just a egg carton that holds 14 eggs with a fancy cover. Would like to replace but I think it was only a 30 day warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Eberhart

customer_reviews.title: Additional cost of $4.99 a month to work
customer_reviews.text: After receiving the product I learned that it will not work unless you subscribe to Quirky at $4.99 a month. Of course now I see that the product is listed as non-refundable. Do not buy this product unless by some chance you already subscribe to the Quirky service. Very unethical for the seller to not mention this.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: it doesn't seem to work... honestly the box was destroyed and looked very used but since I bought it "new" I ignored it. I don't know whether it's a piece of junk or someone used it til it quit working then sold it. It always lights up blue in the same spot when I open it then needs new batteries in like a week after doing nothing else
customer_reviews.author: AimeeCRR

customer_reviews.title: Does Your Fridge Have Wifi? Good for you. As for the rest of us...
customer_reviews.text: Apparently Quirky stopped making this product several years ago, so when I was having issues setting it up, the customer service representative was pretty honest in that his only advice was to "turn it off, turn it on again and try to reset it," which I tried to no avail. I couldn't get it to sync with my phone and how it can connect to WIFI inside (an essentially) metal box (aka the fridge) is beyond me. On the upside, I didn't pay too much for it and my eggs are beautifully displayed in my fridge. So... meh?
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: I was weary, but it works!
customer_reviews.text: I love Wink. I was very worried this product would not work given the very mixed reviews, and the fact that Quirky declared bankruptcy after this product was on the market. But it worked! It took a couple tries to sync with the freaky flashing light programming, but I was able to get it. For $12 I would highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: EH

customer_reviews.title: Egg Minder is Indeed Quirky
customer_reviews.text: It possibly works, however the company went out of business, the Egg Minder did not sync properly the first time and it was not possible to determine the date eggs were inserted, or when eggs had gone bad. Later re-installation of the app seemed to resolve the issues, but I have not yet placed a new carton of eggs in the Minder to test it. The instruction manual was available later, but is not set up to easily print it.
customer_reviews.author: Paukey

customer_reviews.title: This did not last very long
customer_reviews.text: Sad but this did not last very long. Battery life sucks. Even with buying lithium. Great concept but becomes worth less after Wink bricked the hub.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Fitness

customer_reviews.title: It's about 8' from the hub and is not always ...
customer_reviews.text: It's about 8' from the hub and is not always connected. Doesn't work well with large white eggs. Need to be bigger or brown. And with it's constant connecting, the batteries die faster on this than a pair of Beats headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Yep, they ALL cracked up
customer_reviews.text: Everyone is cracking up (pun intended) when they see or hear I bought this device. From a techie standpoint, you have to be patient to get it on your internal network or Wink. The reason they have 14 eggs in the holder is simple, 3 eggs is considered (you are) low and a new carton normally contains 12 eggs. It probably won't fit in your current egg tray, if you have one in the door, as it's too long. I would not have bought it for $50, but $9 was worth it, just as a conversation piece alone.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Fair

customer_reviews.title: Batteries go stale before eggs.
customer_reviews.text: Loves to eat batteries. I'm don't go through eggs all that fast but the eggs lasted longer than the batteries... Amazon brand batteries or name brand did not matter. Potentially the problem is that the "polling" is unable to connect with the fridge door closed? If they perhaps placed a light sensor on the surface so it only tried to communicate with the door open?
customer_reviews.author: amateur biker

customer_reviews.title: Novelty Item
customer_reviews.text: Completely useless to tell how many eggs you have remotely. As an egg holder it does great. But to be used as it's advertised, it complete junk. I think the idea is a great one and think this would be great to utilize in a larger scale, say a whole fridge. That's "if" and a big "if" it works.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Plow9

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could return
customer_reviews.text: Bought for gifts & myself... Was disappointed with results,, Worked for a short period or Did not work at all
customer_reviews.author: Mariecat B.

customer_reviews.title: Do not bother!
customer_reviews.text: Multiple tries. Product never connected to my WiFi. What a waste of my hard-earned $$$$ 😡😡😡😡😡
customer_reviews.author: Susfam

customer_reviews.title: Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Quirky is no longer in business. Contacted Wink (the app that works with this) and they were rude. They told me I have a defective product, but what's more there are no updates for this device as Quirky is no more. If your product works out of the box, enjoy it for the short time it will. Don't update your phone
customer_reviews.author: Ellemarie

customer_reviews.title: Setup Using the Wink App
customer_reviews.text: The app for this is still available. I downloaded the Wink app and then connected a Quirky + GE device. It took me maybe five minutes to setup. It’s a cute device meant for fun. Keeping the lid on the egg minder helps battery life!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Non-op, but makes a nice storage box.
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible product. Quirky at best, completely non-functional at worst. From day one, this product gave inaccurate inventory readings and continuously sent notifications that it was out of eggs when it was full. It has been in the fridge for two months and is completely dead. For $9, it makes a nice egg storage box. I'd avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: pseudofoodie

customer_reviews.title: Quirky
customer_reviews.text: I can’t even find the app that shows the egg minder! Any help would be appreciated
customer_reviews.author: Dimples

customer_reviews.title: Boiling water sound on app is accurate reflection of anger level when trying to connect.
customer_reviews.text: "irelessly connects to your mobile device to track the number of eggs you have and tell you when they're going bad" is the first bullet of the description. NOT SO MUCH. Much ire. NOT SO MUCH. Super cool idea. Watching two programmers laughing trying to set it up. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: EasyA

customer_reviews.title: For someone who loves data, this is a must ...
customer_reviews.text: For someone who loves data, this is a must. It tells you everything you have ever wanted to know about your eggs.
customer_reviews.author: R Champion

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Completely stopped working after a month. And yes, it was charged.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Works if the Wink Hub is Close
customer_reviews.text: Really great quality. Not very accurate, but a great conversation piece. I'm hoping things start working better with updates and more use. Appears to need to be close to the Wink hub to setup and I have verified that if the Wink hub is closer to the Egg Minder it becomes very accurate. I moved the hub to the wall behind my refrigerator & all is great for now.
customer_reviews.author: Vipered

customer_reviews.title: Syncing is a Pain but Works once Set up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this upon some reviews from others youtube. They helped me sync it better than the app did (USE T YOUTUBE). Took me a couple of times to sync. Once synced it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: it may be a good product but I tried 2 of them and they wouldn,t connect to my phone
customer_reviews.author: shulamit10

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't connect to my Wink Hub 2. Tried multiple times with no results. Amazon refunded the cost and had me throw it away instead of sending it back
customer_reviews.author: mjonesjr

customer_reviews.title: Looks pretty, but does Not work, at all!
customer_reviews.text: The box containing the egg minder did not look new. I have connected several things to my phone, my smart things hub and Alexa, so I did not anticipate any problems with this egg minder. Boy was I wrong! After numerous tries, I have accepted the fact that that this is nothing more than an expensive egg carton container. Don't waste your time or money on this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Where's the App??
customer_reviews.text: What the heck? First thing they tell you to do is download the Wink app from the app store. When I searched for Wink - no search results. Tired Egg Minder - same. Tried Quirky Egg Minder - nada. Tried Quirky+GE Egg Minder - nope. Wink Egg Minder, again nothing. What's the deal? This thing lights up to pair but that's it. No blue lights to tell me which egg is up next without an app. Nice sturdy, professional looking packaging, but nothing going on.
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Got to love it for less than $20.
customer_reviews.text: Cadbury Creme eggs also conveniently fits inside the egg minder. I have to give it 5 stars because it's less than $14 and it connects to the internet, has its own app and can control your lights if you're savvy enough to connect it to the right IfTTT recipes. 20 years ago The Sharper Image would have sold this for $100.
customer_reviews.author: Dan German

customer_reviews.title: Before you throw away into the trash read this.
customer_reviews.text: It is NOT true that this is a worthless product. Yes, it does not work as it is supposed to. I, like others, tried countless times to make it work, following the directions exactly, including resetting many times. Yes, it is going into the trash. But, before you throw away - - take out the batteries. They are Ultimate Lithium AA Batteries! Worth at least a few dollars.
customer_reviews.author: KCinDC76

customer_reviews.title: dont waste your money like i did
customer_reviews.text: doesnt work with WINK app. discontinued, dont waste your money like i did.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Eh.
customer_reviews.text: It's a cool idea, but the product needs some work. It disconnects very often and when reconnected, the fresh date of the eggs resets, so you never really know how fresh the eggs are. It also eats up batteries. Sold mine at a yard sale.
customer_reviews.author: JBC614

customer_reviews.title: Wink app does not work
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if the product works. I tried to download the Wink app. It does not work. The web page is not there. Says 404. The phone number is disconnected. Their email came back. I emailed Quirky. They emailed me back saying they will look into it. I am still waiting for an answer.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Flint

customer_reviews.title: Item does not always recognize when eggs have been placed ...
customer_reviews.text: Item does not always recognize when eggs have been placed and will sometimes randomly reset date that egg has been placed in it. Item is unreliable and more of a novelty with its current hardware version. Not sure if this is due to using brown eggs but there is nothing in the product description or manual stating that it only works with white eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Love the idea
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea, especially having chickens. The actual unit though unfortunately always says the second egg on the top row is the freshest and can’t seem to fix it. I can go in the app and the rest seem to work but this one always says there’s an egg there and that it’s the oldest.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Murray

customer_reviews.title: A must for Anyone with Backyard Chickens
customer_reviews.text: Really cool gadget! We have started keeping our own backyard chickens and this is perfect for making sure that we are always eating the oldest eggs first. First in first out! A must for anyone who keeps backyard chickens.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Compter

customer_reviews.title: Eggscellent tray if you dont pay full price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it on sale as a gag gift an extreme markdown, and i made it tweet egg puns at my girlfriend whenever we needed eggs. The laughs lasted for a while but after about 9 months it would no longer stay charged and new batteries only lasted about a day or two.
customer_reviews.author: Crazypedia

customer_reviews.title: I needed something to hold eggs. The price was ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to hold eggs. The price was the same as a standard holder so I purchased this. I get warnings that it's low on eggs when it still has eggs in there. I've replaced the batteries a few times, but no change in results.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Natividad

customer_reviews.title: Its a funny product that I get lots of comments on
customer_reviews.text: Its a funny product that I get lots of comments on. It does everything it says it will do and works great with my Wink. I only wish the software would let me enter the exact date the eggs go bad not just set a number of weeks from the day I enter them.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Black

customer_reviews.title: No Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Hardware is ok but iPhone buggy wait over a minute while phone try's to connect to lick six inches away. Now locked out of app. Seven text messages that had wrong verification code later tried to find customer service number. NOT HAPPENING. Silly me a long time ago friend warned me to check website for customer service number before ever purchasing tech item but I didn't . Pass on this item.
customer_reviews.author: John E.

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a wile then stopped telling me what egg to get out next, so I stopped using it.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Huntzinger

customer_reviews.title: Disapointing
customer_reviews.text: Took ten attempts until it paired with my WInk hub. Not practical at all with length and 14 slots instead of dozen slots. Not worth it even at the low price Amazon sells it at.
customer_reviews.author: Kingme

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as advertised..
customer_reviews.text: Really inconsistent. Didn't get to work as advertised. I use it as a dumb egg holder to prevent my wife from saying we wasted the money on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Total waste!
customer_reviews.text: Works...sort of, all it does is determine how long the egg has been in that spot
customer_reviews.author: AJ Crader

customer_reviews.title: I got it on deep discount and it still seems like a rip off
customer_reviews.text: Barely works. The sensor is constantly reporting missing eggs that are still in the Egg Minder, so when you adjust the egg so the minder knows they are there, it registers as a new egg so the date information is inaccurate. I got it on deep discount and it still seems like a rip off...
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Could not set it up
customer_reviews.text: Would not connect for me, although I am knowledgeable with iot, working on them as an engineer. AIt aso requires the wink app which in turn requires location services.
customer_reviews.author: Francois Toubol

customer_reviews.title: was difficult to get to connect but i think the ...
customer_reviews.text: was difficult to get to connect but i think the main problem is that it dosent reconize the 5.0 network reset you phone to the 2,4 network before you start and i will then connect you may need to go thru the reset procedure 1st
customer_reviews.author: Roger Hempel

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, but tracking sucks
customer_reviews.text: Looks good as a simple Egg Tray, for its price, if you buy it on sale. Works terrible as an egg reminder. The setup step was amazing, using the phone to setup Wi-Fi with a strobe light. Brilliant. Past that, every time you open the lid, you have a random chance for it to detect the eggs. Good luck! Then when it detects a missing egg again, it resets the day counter. Forget the tracker, and be happy with a nice looking tray.
customer_reviews.author: Gui Moura

customer_reviews.title: This product does not work
customer_reviews.text: Dont fool yourself. The product doesnt work. Keep your money. They wont accept returns. Stealing money from consumer. Bad business.
customer_reviews.author: David Brown

customer_reviews.title: This thing never worked.
customer_reviews.text: Mind you, I should have expected it to have problems. It's trying to get a WiFi signal though a fridge.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald P Edens

customer_reviews.title: One and done
customer_reviews.text: Once it has been configured with a wifi AP there is not way to reset it and pair it with another device.
customer_reviews.author: Guttenaffe

customer_reviews.title: Play with your eggs
customer_reviews.text: Not accurate! It's too sensitive. If you have extra 2 hours to play with all the eggs to make sure the sensors actually register each egg, go for it. Cute device but useless.
customer_reviews.author: Antonin Vrabec

customer_reviews.title: Neat and geeky but doesn't work reliably. But come ...
customer_reviews.text: Neat and geeky but doesn't work reliably. But come on, it was $9 and a little bit hilarious. Gave it to a geek friend who repurposed it.
customer_reviews.author: mmtol

customer_reviews.title: Amazon buy safe buy quality
customer_reviews.text: A very high quality product and quick service recommend buying
customer_reviews.author: silver chantai

customer_reviews.title: Great Gadget
customer_reviews.text: A great gadget. Able to monitor how many eggs we have on hand while shopping.
customer_reviews.author: Tumi

customer_reviews.title: Handy device, frustrating setup.
customer_reviews.text: I tried over 30 times to pair the egg minder with my router with no luck using my Android phone. Grabbed my wife's iPhone and it worked the first time. That was frustrating. But now that it is paired it's a pretty cool device. It's nice to see which eggs are the oldest because we don't go through eggs very fast. It's also nice to not have to call my wife and ask if we need eggs when I'm at the store, I can just see myself. I purchased the Egg Minder when it was on sale for $10. While I do think it's a cool device, I wouldn't buy it at full retail or even more than $20.
customer_reviews.author: Hotmann

customer_reviews.title: Coolest Thing Ever
customer_reviews.text: The product is very nice but it took awhile to connect the Egg Minder to my Smartphone. I had to try about 6-7 times before it connected. You also have to download the Wink app. Once all of that was done, I was really excited. The Egg Minder is very nicely made and it really reads the eggs in there and tells you how many days you have left until your egg/eggs are bad. This is the coolest thing ever. You must get one. In addition, I tend to forget everything and the egg minder will let me know when it is time to buy more eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Heaven

customer_reviews.title: Glad my life doesn't depend on its accuracy.
customer_reviews.text: This ended up being a decent IoT toy, but it isn't very accurate. It commonly "loses count" and shows erratic numbers of eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: If I could give this thing 0 stars I would.
customer_reviews.text: Tried 3 different ones, all of them had faulty sensors for the egg trays, and a big problem is, if one of the sensors is faulty, the entire product becomes useless.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: It works great on my Wink system. I have chicken's and it help me keep up with which eggs are the oldest. I would buy again if I needed one.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Sketchy at best as far as accuracy. Pain when pairing with WINK. Don't like WINK either.
customer_reviews.author: Wes S

customer_reviews.title: A bit quirky
customer_reviews.text: Good idea but often fails to work or loses connection or misrepresent
customer_reviews.author: Jamal Khalid

customer_reviews.title: The Real Internet of Things
customer_reviews.text: Very nice ! Works good, with several alerts preconfigured. Ideal for those who have more in their minds than care about eggs, but with kids who love it !
customer_reviews.author: Adriano Leal

customer_reviews.title: Fun but eats batteries
customer_reviews.text: Enjoy it for a while but it has trouble shutting off in the fridge so I got tired of replacing batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Looks great I really wanted to like this product but it ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks great I really wanted to like this product but it just doesn't count eggs accurately
customer_reviews.author: Bmxican

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't detect most eggs.
customer_reviews.text: This was cheap, so I tried it. It took a little work to get connected to the network, but that's working fine now. But it doesn't seem to properly detect when there are eggs in it. I don't know if it's because I buy brown eggs. So it doesn't do the one thing I bought it for. Luckily was cheap enough (on sale) that I can use it as a normal egg holder without feeling like I wasted too much money.
customer_reviews.author: Laird A. Popkin

customer_reviews.title: Never Buy This Product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Keeps having issue with the connection to my Wink App! Never show the right number of eggs... Just using it for fancy looking on my refrigerator, basically for show off!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jam

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy old stock and don't work
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed they don't work my neighbors work great mine don't at all gave up from shap of boxes laying around a long time
customer_reviews.author: Donald F.

product_meta.title: Quirky Egg Minder Wink App Enabled Smart Egg Tray, PEGGM-WH01
product_meta.description: Quirky and GE comes the Wink Egg Minder Smart Egg Tray that adds a new level of intelligence to your everyday lives and the kitchen. The Egg Minder features a built-in Wi-Fi chip to allow it to sync up to your smart device via the Wink app. Once paired with your smartphone or tablet you can now open the app from anywhere to view how many eggs you have which can be incredibly handy on impromptu grocery shopping trips or if you simply just don't think to check on your egg count before heading out the door. This alone is very convenient but the Egg Minder can still do more. In the actual egg crate next to each egg is an LED light that will alert you to which egg of the bunch is the oldest and should be used next and when that egg is removed from the Egg Minder the next oldest will be indicated and so on. The Egg Minder will also communicate with you through various push-notifications to alert you to when an egg has gone bad, an egg is close to going bad, and even set the Egg Minder to notify you when you are running low on eggs. The Wink app will allow you to choose at what amount of eggs left you want to be notified since a family of five is more likely to run out of eggs quicker than someone living on their own. Up to 14 eggs can be stored in the Egg Minder at one time and to keep the eggs safe while in your refrigerator it also comes with a protective covering. It is powered by two AA batteries (included) and is compatible iOS 6 and above, iPhone 4 and above, and Android OS 2.2 and higher
feature_bullets: It syncs with your smartphone to tell you how many eggs you've got at home (up to 14) and when they're going bad.
irelessly connects to your mobile device to track the number of eggs you have and tell you when they're going bad
In-tray LED lights indicate the oldest egg, while push notifications alert you when you're running low.
heck Egg Minder while at the store; you'll never be in a scramble for a good egg again.
